contentList.content: A subterranean folk, early goblins served in the court of the Queen of Air and Darkness, one of the Feywild’s archfey. Goblins thrived in her dangerous domain thanks to a special boon from her—a supernatural knack for finding the weak spots in foes larger than themselves and for getting out of trouble. Goblins brought this fey boon with them to worlds across the Material Plane, even if they don’t remember the fey realm they inhabited. Now many goblins pursue their own destinies, escaping the plots of both archfey and gods.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being Charmed, and on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against ending the Charmed effect.

When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature’s size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.
Amount of times you can use Fury of the Small.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.
Both shunned and adored by his kind for his magical prowess, this elderly Goblin seeks a new life of adventure and wonder!
